senses.sense_definition: To allow saliva to flow uncontrollably from the mouth.

examples.text: The baby began to <w>slobber</w> on his bib while teething.
Some large dog breeds tend to <w>slobber</w> when they see food.

senses.sense_definition: To cover or wet someone or something with saliva.

examples.text: The friendly puppy <w>slobbered</w> my hand with affection.
He accidentally <w>slobbered</w> the pillow while sleeping deeply.

senses.sense_definition: To kiss someone in a messy or overly enthusiastic way.

examples.text: They were <w>slobbering</w> over each other at the cinema.
I do not want to watch them <w>slobber</w> in public.

senses.sense_definition: To fall thickly and messily, typically describing rain or mud.

examples.text: The cold rain <w>slobbered</w> against the windowpane all afternoon.
Mud <w>slobbered</w> over his boots as he walked through the field.

senses.sense_definition: Saliva or liquid that flows uncontrollably from the mouth.

examples.text: She wiped the <w>slobber</w> from the baby's chin.
There was a spot of dried <w>slobber</w> on his collar.
